metadata.title: CVE-2019-12269 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Enigmail before 2.0.11 allows PGP signature spoofing: for an inline PGP message, an attacker can cause the product to display a "correctly signed" message indication, but display different unauthenticated text.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-12269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

enigmail - 2:2.0.11+ds1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: enigmail package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.0.11+ds1-1').
